cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles WNW of Nassau, or 180 miles SE of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the northwestern Bahamas today, then paralleling the Florida east coast Friday, curving north-northwest along the Georgia/South Carolina coasts Saturday and approaching the southeast North Carolina coast early Sunday before turning seaward
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida east coast between West Palm Beach and Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Edisto Beach to South Santee River, SC (south of Wilmington)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from north of Golden Beach, FL to Edisto Beach, SC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida through North Carolina, including Cape Fear and Wilmington areas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible Saturday night into Sunday with a 42% cumulative chance, gusts could reach near hurricane strength if the center passes close to the Cape Fear region.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 2–4 ft above ground possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches if the center tracks near the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain possible with locally higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential around the port area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents and minor coastal erosion likely ahead of and during the closest approach.
